results.title: Children of fire
results.creator_credit: Mai Masri, Fatima Masri, George Khleifi, BBC-TV and M T C
results.brief_description: Nablus, situated in the Israeli Occupied West Bank and home to 120,000 exiled Palestinians is also the home of filmmaker Mai Masri. It is 9 September 1989 and fourteen years since Mai has been in Nablus when she returns to her hometown to document Palestinian life since the beginning of the Intifada. Mai very quickly finds out that Nablus is not the peaceful town where she grew up - it is instead a place of violence, death, fear and tension, where young children have been robbed of their innocence and often their lives. The Palestinians in Nablus are constantly under survellience the Israeli Army which only serves to heighten the frustration and determination of the younger generation to fight for their freedom and confront the occupiers head-on, albeit with weapons of stones. Children as young as five are aware of their situation as exiles and from the ages of six and seven, many will become street-fighters, their games often replicating real life. Through these children’s personal stories and the violent images in their childish paintings, as well as some rather disturbing film footage of the Israeli soldiers in action, Mai Masri presents an uncompromising and courageous portrayal of Nablus and the children of the Intifada. (Awards: Cairo Television Festival 1995; Feminin Pluriel Festival) In English and Arabic with English subtitles.

results.title: Chelsea flower show '98
results.creator_credit: Julia Runagall, Nigel Farrell, Royal Horticultural Society (Great Britain) and Two Four Productions
results.brief_description: The Chelsea Flower show is a triumph of man, and his gardening skills, over the potential disasters of nature. The 5 day 1998 Chelsea Flower Show, held in the grounds of the Royal Hospital, saw a record number of entries with 770 of the world’s finest horticulturists vying for the prestigious R.H.S. Gold medal. This video is the official souvenir video and offers behind the scenes interviews with entrants and many of the visitors to the show that was broadcast daily on live television. Presented by Alan Titchmarsh.

results.title: Charlotte's web
results.creator_credit: Charles Nichols, Iwao Takamoto, Joseph Barbera, William Hanna, Hanna-Barbera Productions and Sagittarius Productions
results.brief_description: Lovable farmyard characters from E. B. White’s novel cavort, sing and explore their world. Wilbur the pig is afraid he’ll end up on the dinner table, until he is befriended by Charlotte the spider and saved by her magic web. Voices include Debbie Reynolds, Henry Gibson and Agnes Moorehead.

results.title: Charlie Chaplin. Vol. 03
results.brief_description: This compilation video features four of Charlie Chaplin’s short films. “Easy street”: Charlie becomes a policeman and imposes his own brand of order on chaotic Easy Street. “The Immigrant”: Charlie meets a beautiful girl on board a ship. After many hilarious hardships they rescue each other and live happily ever after. “The Cure”: Our hero deposits the contents of his liquor bottle into the curative spa at a Sanatorium. “The Adventurer”: The hectic experiences of an escaped convict, with Charlie starring as the convict.

results.title: Charlie Chaplin. Vol. 02
results.brief_description: This compilation features four of Charlie Chaplin’s short films. “The Pawnshop”: Chaplin stars as the pawnbroker’s assistant. “The Rink”: Chaplin as the waiter. “The Floorwalker” and “One A.M.”: Chaplin as the drunk.

results.title: Charlie Chaplin. Vol. 01
results.brief_description: Charlie Chaplin was born on April 6, 1889 in South London, of not so successful music hall entertainers. At the age of eight, he joined a variety act called “The Eight Lancashire Lads”, and worked throughout England and parts of Europe during his childhood. He toured America in 1910-11 and returned again in 1912-13 when he joined the Keystone company. This compilation features four of his short films, The Vagabond”, “The Fireman”, “The Count” and “Behind the Screen.

results.title: Charlie's angels [DVD]
results.creator_credit: McG, Drew Barrymore, Leonard Goldberg, Nancy Juvonen and Global Entertainment
results.brief_description: This big screen adaptation of the popular 70s TV series sees the return of the beautiful, brilliant and sassy angels who work for billionaire recluse, Charles Townsend. Together with their fellow colleague, Bosley, they are sent to work when an electronic genius, Eric Knox, is kidnapped. They soon discover even bigger problems are at bay when they realise Knox’s latest technology is a system which can monitor voice communication from anywhere in the world. This is an exuberant action comedy which never takes itself seriously, combining modern day themes with elements of 70s cheese. Cast includes: Cameron Diaz, Drew Barrymore, Lucy Liu, Bill Murray, Sam Rockwell, Tim Curry, Kelly Lynch, Crispin Glover and the voice of John Forsythe as Charlie.

constellations_other.name: What's in a name?
constellations_other.description: Pakeezah (1972) star Meena Kumari was not just 'the tragedy queen' of Hindi film – she also wrote poetry under the pseudonym Naaz. From famous families and stage names to gendered disguises, this Constellation explores how women have adopted different names and identities to facilitate their ambition.

results.title: Child molestation: when to say no
results.creator_credit: Dana Young, Elizabeth Young and Charles Cahill and Associates
results.brief_description: Uses four dramatisations to illustrate typical encounters between a child and a child molester. Shows the child how to thwart the attempt of molestation and stresses the importance of reporting such incidents to a responsible adult. Suitable for middle and upper primary school levels.

results.title: Child care means business
results.creator_credit: Louise Leitch, Elena Guest and Commonwealth Department of Human Services and Health
results.brief_description: A panel of employers debate employer sponsored child care, examining economic arguments together with philosophical and practical issues. Andrew Olle hosts a panel including small, medium and big business along with leading work and family strategists.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Louise Leitch, Elena Guest and Commonwealth Department of Human Services and Health
